intro: Cheilanthes suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented rock fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats. The plant features a short rhizome with a dense cluster of lance-shaped, evergreen leaves. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a faintly aromatic scent. It is native to various regions in Asia, including China, India, and Japan.
